summary: This document is a chain of emails from April 26, 2019, between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) staff discussing the preparation of an update memo on the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails focus on coordinating information about the Florida victims litigation and the Crime Victims' Rights Act (CVRA) suit for an upcoming meeting.

persons.name: Sony
persons.context: Addressed in the opening line of the email chain, likely a colleague at the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Millis
persons.context: Mentioned as not being up to speed on the Florida victims litigation and needing background information for an upcoming meeting.

connections.description: Implied colleagues within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, coordinating on legal case updates.

events.title: Email coordination on Epstein case update
events.description: Staff at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York exchange emails to prepare an update memo on the Epstein case, specifically addressing the Florida victims litigation and CVRA suit.

events.title: Scheduled meeting on Epstein case
events.description: A meeting is scheduled for Monday, April 29, 2019, requiring an update memo on the status, recent actions, and next steps in the Epstein case.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively working on the Epstein case as of April 2019, preparing internal updates.
A specific focus was on the Florida victims litigation and the Crime Victims' Rights Act (CVRA) suit related to Epstein.
Staff were coordinating to brief a colleague ('Millis') who was not up to speed on the Florida litigation ahead of a meeting.
The email chain indicates ongoing legal and procedural activity in the Epstein case at the federal level during this period.
